stories.text: This post shows and explains the design of the eBike I built myself. I decided to post it on this specific forum because this is where it all started, by stumbling on another post, as mentioned in my entry.
stories.title: Show HN: I Designed and Built an eBike

stories.text:
A crapload of years ago I used to lurk around the BoS forums. Like this HN community, I remember it being full of interesting topics and advice, all related to the world of selling software (first desktop software and lately SaaS) I even miss the term mISV.

Did you (the older of the place) participated in that forum? Do you know of similar sites still running?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you miss the Bussiness Of Software forums?
Fuckit.py â€“ run any Python code, even if broken

stories.text:
I've been doing interviews with Series B-D startups and one issue that seems to recur is a lack of management experience. Generally, an engineer gets promoted to some level of management, but never learns how to manage. Hard conversations aren't happening, feedback isn't constructive, and the people aspect is left to fend for itself. That's all on top of standard organization challenges like team structure.

Generally, I'd expect the CTO/VP/Director to have more management experience, but in a lot of these cases, they may have the resume, but not the skills.

Has anyone had a career from selling management coaching or consulting on these issues?
stories.title: Ask HN: Has anyone gotten into management coaching for startups?
